flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms flight arrived more than 15 minutes early, automatically meeting Early Arrival criteria when no higher-priority operational cause is confirmed. | • Indicates aircraft was forced to hold because its gate was not yet ready; no evidence of FAA program, mechanical, late departure or other specific root cause—consistent with arriving far ahead of schedule. | • Shows continued holding away from gate due to its early arrival rather than any identified operational issue. | • Rules out Late Departure or other occupancy problems; gate would have been free on-time, reinforcing that the delay stems from SKW4744 arriving too early for planned gate/crew resources.

Evidence_Details.message: Landing Time 07:49, Scheduled Time 08:36 – schedule variance ‑46.4 min

Evidence_Details.message: Skywest 3744/4744, you don't have a gate, so plan on going down to the ramp to hold.

Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows continued holding away from gate due to its early arrival rather than any identified operational issue.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight UAL1849 pushed at 08:17 (8 min EARLY); gate available >7 hrs before SKW4744 landed.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Rules out Late Departure or other occupancy problems; gate would have been free on-time, reinforcing that the delay stems from SKW4744 arriving too early for planned gate/crew resources.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Initial post-landing instruction; aircraft is told to hold, indicating it cannot proceed directly to its gate. | • Controller tells the flight there is no gate available, confirming gate availability—not a late departure—caused the hold. | • More than 31 minutes after landing the aircraft is still maneuvering on the movement area, showing the extended taxi-in caused by waiting for gate assignment. | • Confirms there was no Late Departure at gate F10; the gate should have been open, so delay is tied to early arrival rather than preceding flight. | • Meets ≥15 min early-arrival threshold; with no other root-cause evidence, classification defaults to Early Arrival.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold; establishes schedule-driven condition | • Controller explicitly states no gate available on arrival, matching the expectation that the gate is still occupied because aircraft landed far ahead of schedule | • Aircraft is sent to hold away from the terminal (Quebec) rather than proceed to gate F8, confirming hold due to gate not yet open | • Previous aircraft was not late; therefore compound Early-Arrival-and-Late-Departure condition NOT met, pointing to early arrival as primary cause | • Only after ~44 min taxi/hold does ramp finally bring aircraft to gate, consistent with waiting until scheduled gate-time window opens

flights.Key_Evidence: • Active SuperTug movement immediately after SWA360 landed indicates a tow-off operation was in progress in the ramp area, consistent with a gate being cleared late for the arriving aircraft. | • Additional SuperTug instructions confirm continued towing activity on the concourse during the period SWA360 was holding short of its gate. | • Gate D7 was occupied by an arrival that required towing off rather than a normal departure, matching the Late Tow Off definition and explaining why the gate did not become available until 11:16 despite SWA360’s 10:59 landing.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Landed more than three hours past scheduled arrival – satisfies ≥15-minute late-arrival criterion.
